reviewText: MILLION DOLLAR MERMAID is Esther Williams' best work on film, and is the most successful attempt at combining a passable dramatic story with water ballet that was crucial to the plot of the story.Esther Williams plays the famed Australian swimmer Annette Kellerman, who wowed audiences in London and at New York's Hippodrome with her beautiful water ballets.Williams is good as Kellerman, she seems to have the character well in hand.  Never in any other picture did Williams display her considerable acting talents.  She is terribly good here - both in her acting and in her swimming.Rounding out the cast is Victor Mature, Walter Pidgeon (as her loving father), Donna Corcoran (as the young Annette), and David Brian.There are lavish costumes and beautiful period sets.  The entire production is flawless.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I had read Esther Williams book by the same title and found that I wanted to have the movie as well. It arrived timely and I have watched it and it didn't disappoint. I was very pleased with this transaction.

reviewText: With the exception of "Chicago", "Dreamgirls" and "Slumdog", there is a reason why musicals are not popular and pale today to those of "yester year".  They were made predominantly as lite  but grand entertainment for "war time diversion".  Well the time is again now...but the quality/talent just ain't there anymore for a re-surgance.

reviewText: Esther Williams was lovable and irresistible in this film but if you add the presence of Busby Berkeley, the talented Mervin Le Roy, a very human and extremely imaginative Mature and the presence of that giant actor as Walter Pigdeon was, you will obtain a very worthy movie without major pretensions.The sublime sequences of the aquatic ballet and choreographic numbers are superb and belong to the cinema mythology.
summary: A well deserved homage to Anette Kellerman!
Title: N/A

reviewText: This film starring Esther Williams and Victor Mature, is very entertaining, a biography of Annette Kellerman.  It os very well done, and well worth seeing.
